title: Blu3Whale ED
headline: Girl discovers programming (Building an eating disorder recovery app)
searchDescription: A mobile app that combines community-driven features to help individuals suffering from eating disorders recover · Technovation Girls Semifinalist (Top 8 in Canada) · Python · Kivy · Sentiment Analysis
longDescription: Using Python Kivy, I developed an Android mobile application, Blu3Whale ED, designed to support individuals with eating disorders. The app integrates the MealDB API to provide an in-app recipe search engine tailored to user input and leverages Firebase for user authentication and a public chat forum. I implemented Python’s NLTK library to create a Naïve Bayes algorithm that classifies user moods (e.g., happy, sad) based on text inputs found in the library's lexicon dictionary and visualized this data using matplotlib, enabling users to track their emotional well-being in their recovery. The app achieved recognition as a Top 8 Semifinalist in Canada for the Technovation Girls Competition.

title: YYC Tech Connect
headline: Girl discovers programming with other people (Building an event calendar aggregator)
searchDescription: A calendar aggregator made with React and Flask to centralize ongoing events in the YYC tech sector using the Eventbrite API - I'm banned from this API now :(
longDescription: I developed the backend for YYC Tech Connect, utilizing Flask to manage CRUD operations for the Eventbrite API. The frontend was built with React and Material-UI components to deliver a seamless user experience.

title: Winter Go
headline: Hackathon team saves Calgary's tourism scene
searchDescription: A web-app designed to recommend tourists locations and activities based on the weather. Top 3 project for YYCHacks 2023 · TailwindCSS · Express.js · Figma
longDescription: We created an Express.js app that leveraged the OpenAI API to recommend activities and tourist destinations in a user's vicinity depending on the weather conditions and temperature. We used Tailwind for styling.
tech: An API I forgot the name of

title: Torpedo
headline: Highschoolers undergo the startup cannon event
searchDescription: Landing page for Torpedo, a mentorship platform aimed at connecting young talent with mentorship and skill activation opportunities · Labs Batch X
longDescription: I made Torpedo's waitlist site using React, Tailwind CSS, and Google APIs to manage waitlist data. Building Torpedo was an insightful journey into the realm of startups, and it truly fortified my interest in creating software that can scale to impact a vast number of people. This experience also pivoted some of my interests toward UI/UX design and creating pitch decks for promising products.

title: Alexa Connect
headline: 18 somthing-year-olds pitch to Amazon Alexa (successfully)
searchDescription: An Omegle and house party hybrid app recommendation to Amazon Alexa which matches users based on their shared interests and uses Alexa to guide them through an engaging activity · Consulting
longDescription: Consulted for Amazon Alexa and had the opportunity to pitch the recommendation to executives. We also built a prototype using Figma.

title: Bumblebee
headline: Software Engineer trys turning into an Electrical Engineer (impossible edition)
searchDescription: A self-sustaining battery pack powered by radio waves and solar energy that provides a continuous and reliable stream of electricity · Research · Moonshot Project
longDescription: A moonshot project refers to an ambitious, exploratory, and groundbreaking initiative with high risk but equally high potential impact. My partner and I were exploring the sustainable energy space when we decided to deep dive into the world of wireless electricity. Bumblee was a pivot from a larger-scale idea of implementing a completely wireless energy grid by utilizing MRC (Magnetic Resonance Coupling) technology and enhancing its efficiency with radio wave energy harvesters. Our thinking sought to solve the issue of vulnerable physical infrastructure affecting access to electricity in remote regions and areas impacted by severe natural disasters. We pivoted to the Bumblee battery pack after understanding the associated risks of a completely wireless grid (although we are not far from a future where this exists). Instead, we implemented our previous system—without coupling—on a smaller scale, where energy is supplied through photovoltaic technology and radio wave energy harvesters.

title: Renew
headline: Girl builds a fashion circularity app to help local non-profits
searchDescription: A mobile app built to create a pipeline for charities and nonprofits to gain the supplies they need to scale their missions · Technovation Girls Quarterfinalist
longDescription: I created Renew, a platform that organizes the allocation of excess donations to charities and non-profits. My research in the fashion sustainability space and interviews with niche non-profits revealed that 80% of clothing donations are exported overseas to developing countries, rather than being distributed within our own economy to help scale local charities, non-profits, or aid people in need. I developed a mobile app solution to address this issue by creating a platform that organizes the allocation of excess donations to charities and non-profits. I developed the platform in a week using React Native, Firebase, and Nativewind CSS. I developed a Calendly variation from scratch for scheduling functionality in the app, a direct messaging system, and a browsing page. I have partnered with the local non-profit Good-Neighbor, planning to utilize the app to increase their garment supply and reach more people in need.

title: Drunk Walk Home
headline: Hackathon team attempts to code a stupid game for fun
searchDescription: A game where players navigate unpredictable obstacles and maintain balance on a wobbly journey back home · Creation of Games Game Jam
longDescription: We created a lighthearted, quirky, and challenging game that simulates the chaotic journey of navigating home after a wild night out. Players control a stumbling character who must overcome unpredictable obstacles, maintain balance, and make critical decisions to reach their doorstep safely. Play as a drunk girl and experience a wobbly adventure through the night!

title: Time Machine Rush
headline: University Sweats Build a Working Game in Under a Week
searchDescription: A fast-paced adventure game where players take control of a daring time traveler racing through history to fix temporal disruptions
longDescription: Our project allows you to navigate through a futuristic laboratory—while solving puzzles, avoiding obstacles, and battling time anomalies. With a thrilling blend of action, strategy, and exploration, Time Machine Rush challenges players to restore balance to the timeline before it’s too late. Every second counts in this race against time!

title: The Dinosaur Game
headline: Girl Tries to Recreate Neuralink with 12 year old tech
searchDescription: Brainwave Technology that lets you use your brain to make the dinosaur jump (We promise the dinosaur is trying its' best <3)
longDescription: Our project allows you to control the offline Google Dinosaur Game using your brain waves. To do this, we process real-time EEG data to identify moments of high concentration by focusing on a specific range of brain wave frequencies known as beta band power. To isolate these frequencies, we applied a Butterworth bandpass filter. We then used these frequencies as a trigger action: in this case, if high concentration is detected, press spacebar. How goated is this.

searchDescription: We bring your plans outside of the groupchat
longDescription: Started in the google GEMINI hackathon. Coming to a phone near you
